tasks.name: Choose Focus Tasks
tasks.description: Users can choose to focus on either task 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5. In an ideal situation, all tasks should be completed. However, in this training context, completing a few tasks is acceptable.

completeness.description: Select at least one task to focus on

quality.description: Understand the scope of each task

tasks.name: Analyze Environmental and Cultural Hazards
tasks.description: GPT will ask users to describe different use environments of their product. GPT will continue to describe the key features of those environments based on information from 'example of different environments of a bike'. GPT will ask the user to consider what hazards they would face in those environments and how they would address them.

completeness.description: Describe at least three different use environments
Identify hazards for each environment to users

quality.description: High quality means that users need to describe how the chosen envrionements affect how users interact with the product and how the hazards will happen to users
Propose relevant solutions to identified hazards

presentation.description: Clearly structure environment descriptions and hazard analyses

tasks.name: Assess Health Hazards for Operators
tasks.description: Describe health risks for system operators, considering both short-term and long-term exposure to various elements of the system.

completeness.description: Identify both short-term and long-term health risks
Cover various types of health hazards both long term and short term

quality.description: Describe convincingly the health risks for operators with references. Consider the severity and likelihood of each risk

presentation.description: Organize health risks in a clear, categorized manner

tasks.name: Evaluate Subsystem Workforce Requirements
tasks.description: Describe the interaction between humans and the product, creating detailed scenarios to identify potential problems and solutions.

completeness.description: Cover interactions between 3 different kinds of users and the same sub systems

quality.description: Describe how different users can interact with the same sub systems

presentation.description: Present scenarios and analyses in a logical, easy-to-follow manner

tasks.name: Incorporate Historical Incident Lessons
tasks.description: Research and analyze similar incidents related to the product to inform design and safety considerations.

completeness.description: Research at least three historical incidents
Identify key lessons from each incident

quality.description: Draw conclusions how the current product can be improved by the lessons learned from the incidents
In the description, users describe the behaviours and why accidents happened to users

presentation.description: Present findings in a clear, concise manner

tasks.name: Plan for Future Skill Development
tasks.description: Brainstorm how future trends and technological advancements will change the skills and needs of users.

completeness.description: Consider at least 1 future trends or technologies
Analyze impacts on both workforce and system

quality.description: Provide detailed analysis how the technology will change the skills of the users

presentation.description: Present ideas in a structured, forward-looking manner

environments.name: Carried on a Train
key_features: Space Constraints: Limited space on crowded trains.
Crowds: Busy stations, making it hard to maneuver.
Restrictions: No riding in stations, must walk with or carry the bike.
User Behavior: Rushed users, navigating tight areas.

environments.name: Biking in a Park
key_features: Open Spaces: Wide paths, some paved, some rough.
Pedestrian Traffic: Shared space with walkers, kids, and pets.
Relaxed Atmosphere: Leisurely pace, focused on recreation.
Environmental Factors: Weather and seasonal changes affect terrain.

environments.name: Mountain Biking (Rough Terrain)
key_features: Challenging Terrain: Rocky, uneven, steep trails.
Remote: Far from repair services, self-sufficiency needed.
Physical Demand: High exertion, requiring endurance.
Safety Concerns: Higher injury risk, protective gear required.

environments.name: Stored at Home
key_features: Limited Space: Need compact storage (closet, small apartment).
Accessibility: Easy to store and retrieve, possibly foldable.
Indoor Protection: Must be clean to avoid damaging home surfaces.
Security: Prone to theft in shared spaces, needs locks.

environments.name: Bike for Commuting in Rainy/Wet Conditions
key_features: Wet Surfaces: Slippery roads, slip-resistant tires needed.
Visibility: Reduced visibility, requires lights and reflectors.
Waterproof Gear: Users need rain-resistant clothing and bags.
Maintenance: Frequent cleaning to prevent rust and wear.

types.name: Physical Health Hazards
types.description: Affect the body through forces or conditions

types.name: Chemical Health Hazards
types.description: Caused by exposure to harmful chemicals
examples: Skin irritants from cleaning solvents used in maintenance

types.name: Biological Health Hazards
examples: Infections from contaminated water splashed during rides
Allergies from pollen while cycling outdoors

types.name: Environmental Health Hazards
examples: Air pollution in urban cycling routes

types.name: Mechanical Health Hazards
examples: Pinch points in bike chains during maintenance
